channel.title: Teaching on Yanki Kalfa
channel.description: Recent content in Teaching on Yanki Kalfa

item.title: Courses
item.description: Machine Learning for Finance with Python Johns Hopkins University - SAIS This class introduces ML methods and applies to financial data. Below is the list of topics covered in the class: Introduction to ML and classical time series methods Linear ML methods Tree based methods Hyperparameter selection and CV Introduction to Neural Nets Here is the Syllabus. To access lecture codes please see my Github Repo.

item.title: TA Work
item.description: MGTF 405: Business Forecasting, Winter 22, Fall 22 UCSD-Rady I hold regular discussion sections to go over technical material covered in class. I present and discuss python code related to class material. Here is the Github page, where I keep lecture codes. Here are some of the topics covered: ARIMA Model Selection Methods Vector Autoregressions (VECM) State Space Models Regime Switching Models Volatility Models (G/ARCH) Neural Networks MGTF 495: Data Science for Finance II, Spring 22, Spring 23 UCSD-Rady This class covers supervised and unsupervised learning methods applied to financial data.
